description: Students explore the challenges and opportunities that have occurred in Faribault for people with refugee and immigrant backgrounds and educators and community members working with those communities to create supportive contexts (including educational, social, economic, political) that meet the needs and aspirations of those communities. Offered periodically. Prerequisites: EDUC 260 or EDUC 290.
name: Refugee and Immigrant Experiences
notes: This course will be team-taught with a Carleton Professor.
title: Refugee and Immigrant Experiences in Faribault, MN
